alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 5:08PM CDT until July 18 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Johnson County in east Tennessee... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 608 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Abingdon to near Mountain City to 7 miles west of Peoria, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Mountain City, Trade, Doeville, Neva, Shady Valley and Laurel Bloomery. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
